content: पावन {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (नी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [पू-णिच् ल्बु] {@--1@} Purifying, freeing from sin, purificatory, sanctifying; पादास्तामभितो निषण्णहरिणा गौरीगुरोः पावनाः <ls>Ś. 6. 16</ls>, <ls>R. 15. 101</ls>, <ls n="R.">19. 53</ls>; <ls>Bg. 18. 5</ls>, <ls>Ms. 2. 26</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 307.</ls> {@--2@} Sacred, holy, pure, purified; <ls>Ku. 5. 17.</ls> --नः {@--1@} Fire. {@--2@} Incense. {@--3@} A kind of demi-god or Siddha. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of the poet Vyāsa. {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu. --नं {@--1@} Purifying, purification; पदनखनीरजनितजनपावन <ls>Gīt. 1.</ls> {@--2@} Penance. {@--3@} Water. {@--4@} Cow-dung. {@--5@} A sectarial mark. {@--6@} Any means of purification; <ls>U. 1. 13.</ls> {@--7@} Atonement, expiation. {@--8@} Incense (सिह्लक).
पावनी {@--1@} The holy basil. {@--2@} A cow. {@--3@} The river Ganges.
